website_summaries.verdict: Yamaha's RX-V667 is one of the best midrange AV receivers of 2010, with excellent sound quality, a best-in-class user interface, and more connectivity than its competitors, but it may be more AV receiver than you need.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have this paired with the polk monitor 70's, a CS-20 center, 505 Sub, Polk monitor 30's in the rear, and a pair of fishers that are nearly as old as me for front presence. I couldn't be happier, all of the input and output option are there to play with as you see fit. The sound stage, especially with the front presences hooked up, is fantastic, clear, crisp, and incredibly wide. Initial impressions were neutral, due to the limitations in my original system, but the more i've added to the setup, the more I've found the 667 can handle anything I want it to. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Doc T

customer_reviews.title: Surround Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my first full-compliment home theater. The features and instruction are reasonably clear. The HDMI throughput is crystal, the presets are amazing. The unit comes with a microphone with a cable that easily reaches the center of any room, I used it to run the "auto-configure" on the unit which literally balanced all 7 speakers I installed in less than 2 minutes. Amazing sound. Only thing missing from this unit is a built-in PC-VGA input. I can deal with that.
customer_reviews.author: JBeau

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic entry level receiver
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic entry level receiver. I bought this back in 2011, and is still going strong, though it is starting to show its age. There are some functionality features that would be nice today, namely wifi. Very durable, I hear horror stories about other receivers failing after a couple of years. So far, this thing is still going.
customer_reviews.author: Poovs

customer_reviews.title: Great system and has been a valuable addition to my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great system and has been a valuable addition to my AV setup. I replaced an older Yamaha and will replace this again once we move to 4k as that is the one thing this deck doesn't have. Setup is very easy on the system and has integrated very well with my Tivo, Wii, Apple TV and BluRay.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: While it was easy to hook up, I almost always have to turn it off and on again for the speakers to work for TV viewing. If I turn the TV on and receiver on at the same time - no speakers. I have to wait for the TV to be fully on before I turn the receiver on. Also, if I go from CD/DVD player to TV viewing, I have to turn the receiver off and on again for the speakers to work. Not sure if it is the way I hooked it up (doubt it)or just the receiver itself. I consider it a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Dale C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my Yamaha HTR-5635 from 2003. Provides great sound, good video processing and a multitude of settings to dial it in.. Can easily drive 7 speakers and 2 powered subs. Yamaha once again proves they are second to none when it comes to receivers...
customer_reviews.author: R. Novak

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: A very nice receiver. Have all my other components running through it.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Perfection comes in a little black box
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I had an HK - and this blows it away. Sound mix is perfect. Setup is a breeze - even though you have to read the manual on a pc/cd - oh well, I didn't need the manual anyway. It's perfect. Well kind of...they were out of the 667 so they sent me the 671. And I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit for 3 months now and all I can really say is that I'm a very happy customer. It just worked right out of the box. Everything (PS3, Wii, projector) that I've hooked up to it works perfectly. Picture, and sound is top notch for its price. And the on screen menu is the best I've seen on a receiver. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Good sounds
customer_reviews.text: Using it with Onko speakers and it sounds great. Connects to my wired network well but the program menu is lacking. The remote menu on a network computer is mostly useless. Remote is way too complicated and menus are not very well arranged. I would think that with so many years behind them Yamaha would have a better program staff. For such a good sound the interconnectivity is very second rate. It works but I have to use several remotes to get every thing turned on with the home theater system, Pandora and Sirius work well but a pain to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Cleland

customer_reviews.title: excellent value and perfomance
customer_reviews.text: Updated from a 12 year old yamaha and I was blown away with the superior sound from the old unit the setup was simple, it took about 2 hours to rewire and set the speakers.I upgraded to 7.2 from 5.1, put in transformers Dark side of the moon(THE BEST MOVIE AVAILABLE TO DISPLAY 7.1 SOUND)and could not believe the true separation of the surround speakers.I can now hear faint sounds from my speakers I never knew existed.Buy this unit,cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: E man

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked and set up,very easy.I am very happy with the sound quality and surround effects. I have owned Onkyo,JVC,Maranz,& Harmon Kardon. This reciever blows them all away.....Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: 88fan

customer_reviews.title: One of the last affordable 6-channel units
customer_reviews.text: An excellent receiver ... one of the last to still have six channel in/out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Steffens

customer_reviews.title: My new HT amp.
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of searching I decided to buy the Yamaha RX-V667 . It was priced right and the reviews spoke about it's sound quality. It does sound better than my older Sherwood HT amp . Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: Exelent
customer_reviews.text: The best receiver for the money great sound great picture easy to use the second zone works great and with my mts speakers it's loud and clear. Need for Speed hot pursuit you can hear the gravel under the tires of a car next to you
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome receiver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver for my system. Given that I have old components mixed with new components, this receiver made them play well together. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Lee C. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great Reciever - Poor Remote
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Yamaha products for over 35 years and have been pleased with their sound quality every time and this reciever is the same. My only complaint is with the remote. It is very hard to figure out and once you do it is not very user friendly. Get the reciever and buy a logitech remote and be happy once again.
customer_reviews.author: Kojak42

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V667 Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver for my home theater set-up, and I am very happy with my purchase. It was easy to set up (I downloaded its operating manual for additional guidance). It was particularly easy to balance all the attached speakers when using the microphone that comes with the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Astro57

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Yamaha RX-V receiver. I bought the first in 1991, the second in 2001 and this one in 2012. I still have the other two, and they are working fine performing duties in other rooms. When my father in law learned I was considering buying this one, he wanted one, so I bought two! When my best friend heard I bought one, he asked for the link and bought one for himself! Everyone is extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: HeyJP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome choice
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with my Bose speakers. This is a decent product and I am totally satisfied with it. Its airplay feature lets me play my apple devices and also my PC (through iTunes) audio wirelessly on my home theater. It is little bulky but then most of the receivers are
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-v667 7.2
customer_reviews.text: I got this receiver for a good price! Love it. Simple to set up and easy to use. remote has too many buttons but for some users it's good and for some it's not. overall this is great product for what I paid. Couldn't find better deal!
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: easy setup, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to setup. Auto speaker recognition, microphone provided to level the sound. Very easy to use. Love the easy buttons to make all the connections for DVR, DVD, xbox. So easy for the entire family to use. Sounds great too. Been using the unit for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: SLR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Home Theatre Receiver!!
customer_reviews.text: This Receiver rocks! I have connected it with the Polk Audio RM705 set of 5.1 speakers, a Sony PS3, a Yamaha Dock station and an LG LED 42". The speaker cable used is the Monster big spool of 100 FT for in-wall use. Great features and quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jose B.

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V667 A/V Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver for the money- probably the best on the market. Sound is great as well as the adjustments for the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: larmaroly

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best receiver i have ever owned.Sounds great.I am 78 years old and it was easy to set up.I was disipointed that i cannot use my Bose 901 spks as a seperate connection when i do not want to use my Bose acousmass 6 surround system.
customer_reviews.author: JJCFC

customer_reviews.title: Very good Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Stounding Sound, Zone 2 works fine, Zone 1 and Zone 2 can work simultaneously, installed with 7 Jamo and subwoofer boxes, I am very happy really!
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Solid functionality and quality - bit disapointed about the amount of plastic
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade my system to HDMI - so had to replace my older (only 2 year old) Yamaha RX-V2400 with a HDMI enabled one. Followed CNET guidance and purchased RX-V667. Installation was easy. Sound quality is as good as the older unit. Menues are now more colorful and UI to setup the device has improved too. Only downside is that the RX-V667 certainly comes with more plastic compared to the older RX-V2400 - looks cheaper (was the reason for only rating 4). Would certainly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: onerok

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha = Great Stereo
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like, one room with the sounds just like you're there and the option for sound outside too.
customer_reviews.author: jim in NC

customer_reviews.title: Sound is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: excellent for my home theater system, works well with Harmony remote
customer_reviews.author: DJ Ref

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Receiver met all our expectations. Set up was simple and went well. setting up sound distribution for our family room required 3 attempts to make sure we did it correctly. Very satisfied with the quality of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: The Yamaha RX-V667 7.2 is everything I wanted. What power, what sound!! it's just amazing!! it has soooo many entries for HDMI, that is just wow!! What I love most is that it has so many functions, but it's so easy to use!! I totally recommend it for you!!
customer_reviews.author: wilelliot

customer_reviews.title: great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: I researched a number of receviers that would accomodate a mid-level investment in a home theater room and this recevier has not dissapointed! It delivers high performance at a fantastic price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: z-man

customer_reviews.title: Wrong receiver shipped
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Yamaha RX-V667 7.2 receiver. I was shipped the RX-V667 7.1 model. The price was the same on the 2 models so rather than go through the hassel of sending the receiver back, I decided to just stay with what was shipped to me. This unit is a quality product that does exactly what I wanted it to do. Just slightly frustrated with the shipping error.
customer_reviews.author: dbc0516

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Great power - great for connecting to a TV and stereo equipment....
customer_reviews.author: Greg C. Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Excelent receiver
customer_reviews.text: Excelente receiver. Very easy setup. Sound quality like superior a/v receivers. Image quality in blue ray excelent. Till now didn,t try the 3D capability
customer_reviews.author: S. Sosa

customer_reviews.title: Will not down convert HD Audio to RCA
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this receiver my ONLY gripe is that the Audio out (rca) will not output audio if you have a HD (HDMI) source. Thinking my unit was defective I called customer support (whom were very helpful) and they informed me that the unit would not "down-convert" HD or digital audio to the analog audio out. Seems very silly to me as that is the job of a receiver. The audio out connection is practically useless as I imagine anyone buying this does so for the surround (digital audio) and will have HD sources.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P.

customer_reviews.title: Liked this receiver
customer_reviews.text: It's a little confusing for luddites to use, but they can be taught, with a little effort. Lots of flexibility with all of the inputs. Video upconversion is quite good, and the sound is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bickley

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: loved it for 3 wks and it started shuting down on its own got more frequent, now it just will not power up
customer_reviews.author: hd

customer_reviews.title: I HAVE NOT USE IT YET STILL IN BOX, BUT MY NEPHEW IS A DJ AND HE SAYS IS THE TOP OF THE LINE WITH KLIPSCH SPEAKERS
customer_reviews.text: STILL IN THE BOX IT CAME, BUT MY NEPHEW A DJ SAID THAT THE YAMAHA THAT I GOT IS TOP OF THE LINE, I WILL COMMENT FURTHER WHEN I GET THE KLIPSCH QUINTED SYSTM 5.1 AND SW-112 POWER SUBWOOFER FROM KLIPCSH.
customer_reviews.author: EDGARDO

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 34 days.
customer_reviews.text: I paid thousands of dollars for a whole house audio video system, and this reciever broke afer 34 days and Amazon would not honor a return. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS TYPE OF EQUIPMENT FROM AMAZON. GO LOCAL.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

product_meta.title: Yamaha RX-V667 7.2-Channel Home Theater Receiver (OLD VERSION) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Enjoy a revolutionary home theater experience with the Yamaha RX-V667 Audio Video Receiver. With 90 watts per 7 channels, 6 HDMI inputs (including a front input), multizone support, and the latest hi-def audio and HDMI specs for upscaling to 1080p, this receiver plays well with all your home theater equipment. Enjoy more than just your movies with SIRIUS-ready and paired compatibility, as well as iPod support for album art (when connected via supported dock, sold separately). There's also a full-color GUI for controlling all the action when connected via HDMI.Power Requirements: 120VAC, 60Hz.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


YAMAHA RX-V667 RECEIVER: A NEW WORLD OF FUNCTIONALITY AND CONNECTIVITY
Enjoy the latest in true high-definition entertainment with the Yamaha RX-V667 Audio/Video Receiver. In addition to full compatibility with the latest hi-def audio and video codecs, the RX-V667 offers true 1080p upscaling, plenty of HDMI inputs for all your devices, multizone support, and more--all along with the custom features you'd expect from a Yamaha receiver, such as SCENE setup, YPAO sound optimization, and Virtual CINEMA DSP. 


6 HMDI inputs (including one front input) give you maximum flexibility
View Back Panel 
The Yamaha RX-V667 is the latest in true high-definition entertainment HDMI and Analog Upscaling to 1080p
Six HDMI inputs (including one front input) and two analog video inputs give you maximum flexibility in your home theater setup�all with true 1080p video upscaling. Support for the latest HDMI 1.4 specification gives you rich, 3D video quality with Deep Color, x.v. Color, and Auto Lip-Sync compensation. 

Advanced GUI and iPod Album Art Support and Compressed Music Enhancer
When connected to your flat-panel HDTV via HDMI, an advanced GUI overlay becomes available to control your home theater simply and easily. When your iPod or iPhone is connected to the Yamaha RX-V667 via a supported Yamaha iPod dock (sold separately), you can listen to your digital music with Compressed Music Enhancer and view album art while playing. 

Compressed Music Enhancer is a sophisticated type of digital signal processing using exclusive algorithms to improve the performance of compressed music formats such as MP3 and WMA. With the Compressed Music Enhancer, highs and especially lows are richer and smoother, bringing music back to life to be as close to the original as possible. 

Seven Channels of High-Definition Surround-Sound Audio
The RX-V667 receiver offers 90 watts per channel of rich, high-definition audio with support for the latest sound decoders like HD Audio, Dolby TrueHD, DTS-HD Master Audio, Dolby Digital Plus, and DTS-HD High Resolution Audio. Its discrete amp configuration minimizes signal interference, further enhanced by low-jitter PLL circuitry. The RX-V667's intelligent assignable amplifiers let you perfect your surround sound setup or push a signal to a Zone 2 connection for enjoying in another room. 

Achieve Surround Realism with CINEMA DSP
Conventional multichannel audio reproduction systems base their sound on Dolby Digital and DTS decoding, using matrix and steering technologies to create surround sound effects. Yamaha CINEMA DSP is much more advanced, actually creating richly realized independent sound fields that envelop you in an unmatched surround sound experience. With dialogue, music and effects from ideally located in these separate sound fields, you will hear sound with accurate placement, smooth movement, exceptional clarity and richness, and startlingly realistic presence. 


Hear large-scale sound through
headphones with SILENT CINEMA SILENT CINEMA and Virtual CINEMA DSP
SILENT CINEMA makes it possible to hear large-scale surround sound through ordinary headphones. This variation of CINEMA DSP technology lets you listen in private to movies and other multi-channel sources for hours without listening fatigue. Virtual CINEMA DSP lets you enjoy the effects of CINEMA DSP surround sound without using surround speakers--handy for use in custom installations where some rooms don't have surround speakers. It can be used with the front / center / presence speakers or even with just the two front left and right speakers. 


SCENE buttons automatically launch an operation 
that will play the source controlled by that button 
YPAO uses this microphone to analyze room acoustics and
automatically set the best sound for any room SCENE Buttons for Quick Control of Your Home Theater
Four SCENE buttons make operating the receiver easier than ever. They are initially set to default settings for DVD Viewing, Disc Listening, TV Viewing and Radio Listening. Pressing a SCENE button automatically launches a number of operations that initiate play of the source controlled by that button. Other SCENE settings are also available, such as iPod Listening, XM Listening, TV Sports Viewing and Action Game Playing. Browsing and selecting the settings is quickly accomplished by changing Input via the front panel and watching the on-screen display. The settings can be selected for one-time use, or they can replace the original default settings. The SCENE names can be changed also. 

Automatic Speaker Setup and Calibration with YPAO
Yamaha�s YPAO system uses a small microphone and sophisticated equalization to automatically set the best sound for any room, no matter where the speakers are. First it checks the speaker connections and phase of each speaker. Then it sends out tones which are captured by the microphone to analyze the room acoustics and sets a variety of parameters, such as the speaker size, the distance of the speakers and even the sound pressure level, until it achieves the best sound conditions for your room. 

What's in the Box
>  The Yamaha RX-V667 Receiver Unit YPAO Microphone Radio Antennas for AM/FM Preset Remote Unit 
Optional Accessories for Added Connectivity (Sold Seperately)
>  Yamaha YDS-12 Universal Dock for iPod and iPhone--The optional YDS-12 Universal Dock lets you connect your iPod or iPhone to compatible Yamaha receivers. It's "Works with iPhone"-certified to ensure you get the most out of your portable music library. Yamaha YID-W10 Wireless Dock System for iPod and iPhone--The optional YID-W10 ensures that you enjoy maximum sound quality and no lip sync (AV matching) problems. Yamaha YBA-10 Bluetooth Wireless Audio Receiver--The optional YBA-10 Bluetooth Wireless Audio Receiver docks to compatible Yamaha receivers so users can enjoy music wirelessly from Bluetooth-enabled mobile phones, Windows PCs and Macs. 
Receiver Comparison Chart
HDMI
(Input/Output) HDMI Upscaling HMDI Audio Return
Channel (ARC) 3D Ready SCENE Buttons YPAO
Auto Speaker Setup On-Screen Display Zone Control RX-V367 Version 1.3
(4 in/ 1 out) - - - - - RX-V467 Version 1.4a
(4 in/ 1 out) - - - RX-V567 Version 1.4a
(4 in/ 1 out) - RX-V667 Version 1.4a
(6 in/ 1 out) 

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
>  Output Power: 630W (90W x 7) Dynamic Power/Channel (Front L/R, 8/6/4/2 ohms): 125/160/190/230 W Frequency Response (AV5, Front L/R, Sp Out): 10Hz - 100kHz +0,-3dB Total Harmonic Distortion (AV5, Pure Direct, Front Sp Out): 0.06% (20Hz - 20kHz, 5W/ 8 ohms) Signal-to-Noise Ratio (AV5, Pure Direct, Input Shorted, Sp Out): 100dB (250mV) HDMI (Audio Input Assignable/ Output): 6/ 1 SIRIUS: 1 Analog Audio (Input/ Output): 5/ 2 Component Video (Audio Input Assignable): 2 Zone 2 Audio Out: 1 +12V/0.1A Trigger Out: 1 Dimensions (WxHxD): 17-1/8" x 6" x 14-3/8" Weight: 23.1 lbs
feature_bullets: 6 HDMI inputs (including 1 front input) and the latest HDMI 1.4 specification for true 1080p video upscaling
Dolby Digital Plus, TrueHD, and DTS-HD high-definition audio decoding
Multizone support (2 zones) with intelligent power amp assignment
Full color GUI and iPod album art support
SIRIUS Satellite Radio ready and yAired compatibility
